alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Basin and Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 29 at 1:46PM MDT until May 31 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE WEST CENTRAL BASIN AND RANGE DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY VALUES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .South to southwest winds aloft will strengthen on Wednesday in advance of an upper level trough over Arizona. Additionally, a mid level dry slot will punch through western and central New Mexico. With strong daytime mixing, expect surface winds to gusts between 30 and 35 mph while humidity values fall near or below 10 percent. With high Haines values in place as well, critical fire weather conditions are expected for portions of central and west central New Mexico. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) and the West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109). * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 8 and 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Basin and Range
